System
module System

Provides low-level system control functions for debugging, signaling unimplemented features, or marking unreachable code paths.

These functions immediately halt execution with native behavior, often useful for development, assertion, and exhaustiveness checking.

Functions
panic
function panic(
message
 = 
""
)

Halts execution and reports a fatal error with the given message.

Parameters
message

The error message to display

Behavior

Immediately stops the program and raises an unrecoverable error.

Usage

System.panic("Something went horribly wrong")

todo
function todo(
message
 = 
""
)

Marks a piece of code as "to be implemented".

Parameters
message

An optional message describing what’s missing

Behavior

Panics at runtime to indicate that this code hasn’t been written yet.

Usage

System.todo("Finish the file upload logic here")

unreachable
function unreachable(
message
 = 
""
)

Marks a branch of code as logically unreachable.

Parameters
message

A message to display if somehow this code is reached

Behavior

Panics at runtime to indicate an internal logic error or failed exhaustiveness.

Usage

System.unreachable("Should never hit this case")
